definition: paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc
to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself

sentences.english: It is typical in the modern cold forging to Cold-Extrude the involute cylindrical gear spline.
sentences.chinese: 渐开线花键冷挤压成形工艺是冷锻加上中的一个典型。

sentences.english: The main rason of leading to overhigh hydrogen content was insufficient anneal after forged.
sentences.chinese: 导致氢含量过高的原因可能在于锻后退火不足。

sentences.english: Hand forging tools comprise variously shaped hammers.
sentences.chinese: 手锻工具包括各种形状的锻锤。

sentences.english: The small churchyard was surrounded by a rusted wrought-iron fence.
sentences.chinese: 这个小墓地被一道生锈的锻铁栅栏围着。

sentences.english: At the same time, the developments of technique and equipments have been elucidated.
sentences.chinese: 同时还叙述了冷温锻复合成形技术和设备的发展。

sentences.english: We incorperate automatic lubrication systems into all of our rotary swagers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旋转锤锻机上装有自动润滑系统。

sentences.english: Best get smithing up before coming here.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，获得最佳锻起来。

sentences.english: The paper gives out structure of tilting pin type hydraulic forging die for producing frame of shaker.
sentences.chinese: 给出了震动器机壳斜销式液锻模具设计结构。

sentences.english: We choose alloy cold forging of high-hardness for machining .
sentences.chinese: 选用高硬度合金冷锻，配以机械切削成型。

sentences.english: To increase top forging pressure during applying welding.
sentences.chinese: 增加施焊时的顶锻压力。

sentences.english: It has elaborated the advantages replacing hot die forging with the cold forging technology.
sentences.chinese: 阐述了用冷锻工艺代替热模锻的优点。

sentences.english: The technology of precision roll forging by closed die groove of machine driven plough share are researched systematically.
sentences.chinese: 系统研究了机引犁铧闭式型槽精密辊锻技术。

sentences.english: The bevel gear's cold forging die was designed based on the principles of cold precision forming.
sentences.chinese: 基于冷锻成形原理，对锥齿轮冷精锻模进行了设计。

definition: to quench/to temper/to harden by quenching
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]
bronze (alloy of copper 銅|铜 and tin 錫|锡[xi1])
to temper (iron)/to flare back/flareback (in a gas burner)/(of an engine) to backfire
